  • Field Details

    • MAX_SIZE

      public static final int MAX_SIZE
      The maximum size of the board.
      Note that not all coordinates with x,y between 0 and MAX_SIZE are valid.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int numPlayers)
      Initialize board for the given number of players.
      The player number cannot change dynamically throughout the game.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - Total number of players for the game.

  • Method Details

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(Coordinate coordinate)
      Get the tile on the board at the given coordinate
      Parameters:
      coordinate - Coordinate to search for a tile
      Returns:
      Tile at coordinate, null if coordinate is not in the board

    • getTiles

      public Map<Coordinate,Tile> getTiles()
      Get Coordinate to File mapping for the current board.
      The map only contains "legal" coordinates, meaning coordinates usable when playing with the number of players the board has been initialized with.
      Returns:
      Copy of the Coordinate->Tile map

    • removeSelection

      public void removeSelection(List<Coordinate> selection)
      Remove the tiles in the list of selected coordinates.
      Coordinates must be already present in the board.
      Parameters:
      selection - List of coordinates to be emptied

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(Coordinate coordinate, Tile tile) throws OutOfBoundCoordinateException, OccupiedTileException
      Insert tile at given coordinate.
      Coordinate must be already present in the board.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - Coordinate to set the tile at
      tile - Tile to set at given coordinate
      Throws:
      OutOfBoundCoordinateException - If the coordinate doesn't belong to the board
      OccupiedTileException - If the coordinate is already occupied

    • refill

      public void refill(TileBag tileBag)
      Refill the board using the given tilebag.
      The bag will not be modified, as the contents of the tilebag include the contents of the board.
      If not enough tiles are present to refill the board, it will only be partially refilled.
      Refilling happens in a breadth-first approach starting at a random coordinate.
      Parameters:
      tileBag - Bag to draw the tiles from.

    • getAsMatrix

      public Tile[][] getAsMatrix()
      Get the matrix representation of the board as a 9*9 tiles Matrix.
      Invalid positions in the board are represented with null values within the matrix, while unoccupied positions contain Tile.NOTILE
      Returns:
      The tile-matrix rapresentation of the board.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Board's custom gson serializer
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
